entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 12:05AM AKST until November 21 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Light freezing rain likely. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Elevations lower than 1000 ft. * WHEN...Through 9 AM Monday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 10:22PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN THROUGH MONDAY... Strong wind gusts 50 to up to 60 mph and periods of heavy rain with total amounts as high as 2 inches are expected. The strongest winds and highest rainfall totals will be along the outer gulf coast and the southern panhandle as a developing low moves up along the NE Gulf Coast. This will increase the risk of impacts

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida...
